 However, I try to force myself to step back, even take 5 mins and come back and reread, before I post. I try to eliminate anything that might be offensive, and I try to be humble in my assertions. I've learned that the old saying "you catch more flies with honey than vinegar" is true. IMHO, nothing turns people off on these boards more than arrogance, especially if that arrogance is combined with sarcasm or name calling. Making suggestions, or pointing people in the right direction so they discover the facts for themselves is IMHO, far more effective in most cases than "telling them how it is" or why they're wrong. Don't underestimate the power of suggestion. ;) 
 
 Patience, humility, and tact are probably the most important lessons I've learned (and am continuing to learn) from these boards. For an example of someone that I consider a role model in this regard, read any posts from Whistler.
